BOOKS.name: Genesis
BOOKS.description: Tells of creation, the fall of humanity, the early history of mankind, the patriarchs Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and Joseph; God’s covenant promises to them upheld even in hardship. 0

BOOKS.name: Exodus
BOOKS.description: Describes Israel’s slavery in Egypt, Moses’ leadership, the plagues, the Exodus from Egypt, covenant at Sinai, and instructions for worship. 1

BOOKS.name: Leviticus
BOOKS.description: Focuses on laws and rituals, holiness codes, priestly duties, and how Israel is to live set apart; emphasizes worship and ethical living. 2

BOOKS.name: Numbers
BOOKS.description: Narrates Israel’s wandering in the wilderness, census data, rebellions, provisions, and God’s guidance amid disobedience. 3

BOOKS.name: Deuteronomy
BOOKS.description: Collection of Moses’ speeches reviewing law, covenant obligations, and Israel’s history as they prepare to enter the Promised Land. 4

BOOKS.name: Joshua
BOOKS.description: Israel, under Joshua, conquers Canaan, divides the land among the tribes, and renews their covenant with God. 5

BOOKS.name: Judges
BOOKS.description: Cycle of Israel sinning, being oppressed, crying out, and being rescued by judges; shows the consequences of turning from covenant faithfulness. 6

BOOKS.name: Ruth
BOOKS.description: A story of loyalty, redemption, and God’s providence, focusing on Ruth, a Moabite woman, and her integration into Israel’s story. 7

BOOKS.name: 1 Samuel
BOOKS.description: Transition of Israel from the period of judges to monarchy; story of Samuel, Saul, and the rise of David. 8

BOOKS.name: 2 Samuel
BOOKS.description: Reign of David: his sins, successes, consolidation of the kingdom, and God’s promises to David’s house. 9

BOOKS.name: 1 Kings
BOOKS.description: Begins with Solomon’s reign, wisdom, and temple building; then divides kingdom histories of Israel and Judah, decline, idolatry, and prophets. 10

BOOKS.name: 2 Kings
BOOKS.description: Further history of Israel and Judah’s kings, fall of Israel to Assyria, Judah to Babylon; prophetic ministries and judgment. 11

BOOKS.name: 1 Chronicles
BOOKS.description: Retrospective history emphasizing David and the temple; genealogies; religious reforms in Judah. 12

BOOKS.name: 2 Chronicles
BOOKS.description: Continuation of Israel/Judah’s history focusing more on Judah, temple worship, reforms, exile, and hope. 13

BOOKS.name: Ezra
BOOKS.description: Return from exile under Cyrus, rebuilding of the temple, reforms among the returned exiles, leadership of Ezra. 14

BOOKS.name: Nehemiah
BOOKS.description: Nehemiah leads rebuilding of Jerusalem’s walls, community reforms, renewed covenant, and restoration. 15

BOOKS.name: Esther
BOOKS.description: Story of Esther’s courage in Persia, saving the Jewish people from genocide, God’s providence in unexpected ways. 16

BOOKS.name: Job
BOOKS.description: Explores suffering, divine justice, integrity; dialogues between Job and his friends; God’s response from the whirlwind. 17

BOOKS.name: Psalms
BOOKS.description: Collection of poems, hymns, praises, laments; used in Israel’s worship life; wide range of emotions and human experience. 18

BOOKS.name: Proverbs
BOOKS.description: Wisdom sayings, advice for life, character, discipline, and fear of the Lord as foundational. 19

BOOKS.name: Ecclesiastes
BOOKS.description: Reflections on meaning, vanity, the fleeting nature of life and human accomplishments; calls to fear God and enjoy life. 20

BOOKS.name: Song of Solomon
BOOKS.description: Poetic love dialogue between lovers; often seen as celebrating human love, marriage, and sometimes allegorical spiritual love. 21

BOOKS.name: Isaiah
BOOKS.description: Prophecies of judgment and hope; visions of God’s holiness; future promises including the suffering servant, restoration, and messianic themes. 22

BOOKS.name: Jeremiah
BOOKS.description: Prophet Jeremiah’s warnings of impending judgment for Judah, calls to repentance, suffering of the prophet, and future restoration. 23

BOOKS.name: Lamentations
BOOKS.description: Poetic laments over Jerusalem’s destruction; grief, mourning, confession, and hope. 24

BOOKS.name: Ezekiel
BOOKS.description: Prophecies during exile; visions, symbolic acts; judgment and hope; restoration and new temple vision. 25

BOOKS.name: Daniel
BOOKS.description: Stories and visions; God’s sovereignty over kingdoms; trials of faith; apocalyptic visions about the end times and God’s kingdom. 26

BOOKS.name: Hosea
BOOKS.description: Marriage metaphor for Israel’s unfaithfulness; God’s steadfast love and restoration despite betrayal. 27

BOOKS.name: Joel
BOOKS.description: Prophetic announcements of judgment; call to repentance; promise of outpouring of God’s spirit and restoration. 28

BOOKS.name: Amos
BOOKS.description: Prophet Amos warns Israel of social injustice, hypocrisy; emphasizes justice, righteousness, and warnings before restoration. 29

BOOKS.name: Obadiah
BOOKS.description: Shortest Old Testament book; prophecy against Edom for pride and betrayal, promise of restoration to Israel. 30

BOOKS.name: Jonah
BOOKS.description: Story of a reluctant prophet, God’s mercy to Nineveh; themes of obedience, compassion, and forgiveness. 31

BOOKS.name: Micah
BOOKS.description: Prophecies including messages about judgment for social injustice and hope for a ruler from Bethlehem; God’s requirements for justice, mercy, humility. 32

BOOKS.name: Nahum
BOOKS.description: Prophecy against Nineveh; God’s justice and wrath against cruelty. 33

BOOKS.name: Habakkuk
BOOKS.description: Dialogues between prophet and God about injustice; vision, lament, and ultimately trust in God despite unanswered questions. 34

BOOKS.name: Zephaniah
BOOKS.description: Warning of coming Day of the LORD, calls to repentance; promise of restoration for remnant. 35

BOOKS.name: Haggai
BOOKS.description: Encouragement to rebuild the temple after exile; God’s promise to dwell among His people. 36

BOOKS.name: Zechariah
BOOKS.description: Visions, prophetic oracles, encouragement to return; future hopes including messianic rule. 37

BOOKS.name: Malachi
BOOKS.description: Final prophetic word of the Old Testament; addresses Israel’s faithlessness, call to righteous living, promise of messenger. 38

BOOKS.name: Matthew
BOOKS.description: One of the Gospels; presents Jesus as Messiah, King of the Jews; includes genealogy, teachings, parables, death and resurrection. 39

BOOKS.name: Mark
BOOKS.description: A fast-paced Gospel emphasizing Jesus’ actions, authority, suffering, and that He came to serve; includes many miracles. 40

BOOKS.name: Luke
BOOKS.description: Gospel giving detailed narrative of Jesus’ life, ministry, compassion, parables; careful ordering and historical detail; bridge between Old Testament and early church. 41

BOOKS.name: John
BOOKS.description: Gospel focusing on Jesus’ identity, signs, ‘I am’ statements; emphasizes belief, eternal life, love. 42

BOOKS.name: Acts
BOOKS.description: History of the early Christian church after Jesus’ ascension; spread of the Gospel through apostles; key figures include Peter and Paul. 43

BOOKS.name: Romans
BOOKS.description: Paul’s letter to the church in Rome explaining the gospel, justification by faith, relation of Israel and Gentiles. 44

BOOKS.name: 1 Corinthians
BOOKS.description: Paul addresses problems in Corinth: division, immorality, spiritual gifts, resurrection; guidance for church life. 45

BOOKS.name: 2 Corinthians
BOOKS.description: Paul defends his apostleship, encourages reconciliation, highlights suffering and God’s comfort. 46

BOOKS.name: Galatians
BOOKS.description: Paul refutes legalism, teaches justification by faith in Christ apart from works of the law; Christian freedom. 47

BOOKS.name: Ephesians
BOOKS.description: Paul’s letter about the church as the body of Christ; unity, spiritual blessings, Christian conduct. 48

BOOKS.name: Philippians
BOOKS.description: Letter of encouragement and joy; Christ’s humility and exaltation; contentment in all circumstances. 49

BOOKS.name: Colossians
BOOKS.description: Paul emphasizes Christ’s supremacy and sufficiency; encourages believers to live in Christ and avoid false teachings. 50

BOOKS.name: 1 Thessalonians
BOOKS.description: Paul encourages believers, teaches about Christ’s return, holiness, and how to live in light of that coming. 51

BOOKS.name: 2 Thessalonians
BOOKS.description: Addresses misunderstandings about Christ’s return; encourages perseverance; clarifies timing. 52

BOOKS.name: 1 Timothy
BOOKS.description: Paul gives guidance to Timothy on church leadership, dealing with false teaching, and godly conduct. 53

BOOKS.name: 2 Timothy
BOOKS.description: Paul’s final letter; exhortation to remain faithful, endure suffering, storing up treasure in heaven. 54

BOOKS.name: Titus
BOOKS.description: Instructions for organizing churches, teaching sound doctrine, good works. 55

BOOKS.name: Philemon
BOOKS.description: Personal appeal from Paul to Philemon to receive back his runaway slave Onesimus as a brother in Christ. 56

BOOKS.name: Hebrews
BOOKS.description: Anonymous letter encouraging Jewish Christians; shows the superiority of Christ, fulfillment of the old covenant; perseverance in faith. 57

BOOKS.name: James
BOOKS.description: Faith and works, practical Christian living; emphasis on righteous behavior, patience, and controlling the tongue. 58

BOOKS.name: 1 Peter
BOOKS.description: Encouragement in suffering, hope in Christ, call to holiness and love within the Christian community. 59

BOOKS.name: 2 Peter
BOOKS.description: Warnings against false teachers; reminders of Christ’s return; emphasize knowledge and godly living. 60

BOOKS.name: 1 John
BOOKS.description: Themes of love, truth, fellowship; tests of genuine faith; Christ’s incarnation and victory over evil. 61

BOOKS.name: 2 John
BOOKS.description: Short letter about walking in truth, love, and obedience; warning against false teaching. 62

BOOKS.name: 3 John
BOOKS.description: Personal letter emphasizing hospitality, faithfulness; contrasts good and bad leadership. 63

BOOKS.name: Jude
BOOKS.description: Letter warning against false teachers, calling believers to contend for the faith, emphasizing mercy and judgement. 64

BOOKS.name: Revelation
BOOKS.description: Visions, symbolic prophetic imagery about the end times; the final judgment; new heavens and new earth; encouragement for perseverance. 65
